newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice ends up on institutional support.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice ends up on institutional support.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended up on Wednesday on institutional support but did not breach upper resistance, traders said.
The key September 1996 contract ended at 2,538 yuan ($305) per tonne, up two yuan. It opened at 2,530 yuan, hitting an intra-day low of 2,525 and a high of 2,541.
October rose 20 to 2,550 yuan per tonne.
Combined volume rose to 10,200 tonnes from 1,800.
"Institutional support was responsible for today's rises," one trader said.
Traders said rice would rise further in the next few days.
